title: If someone says 'The school sent a note for a parent-teacher meeting because my son is always naughty,', is it common to say 'a note for a parent-teacher meeting'? If not, what can he or she say instead? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes that’s normal or you could say ““The school sent a note for me to go in and speak with my son’s teacher because he is always naughty.” A school note would actually never use the word ‘naughty’. It would be much more likely to say that ‘‘his behaviour is challenging’ or something similar.

The school sent a note requesting a parent-teacher meeting because my son was being naughty. A native speaker will expect the following sentence: The school sent a note requesting a parent-teacher conference because my son was behaving badly.
